basics.name: Joseph Cauvy-Foster
basics.label: Student
basics.summary:
Currently in the final year of my BSc in Computer Science at the University of the West of England (UWE).

I am looking forward to applying the hard and soft skills I have learnt during my BSc to a professional environment.

Throughout my academic journey, I honed my skills in Data Visualisation, Python, Machine Learning, Git, Swift, Jupyter, HTML, CSS, LaTeX, Docker, Agile practices, and Kotlin. Additionally, I developed strong competencies in listening, receiving feedback, problem-solving, critical thinking, teamwork, written & verbal communication, resourcefulness, creativity, time management, and the ability to learn quickly & pick up new skills.

education.institution: University of the West of England

work.summary: Worked in the bar and on tills at a busy stadium during football and ruby games.

highlights: Worked in a team of 50+ employees, fulfilling online orders within a short time frame.
Servicing customers at the till and on the shop floor.
Came second place, in a team of 12, in a competition to sell the most cocktails during a shift to gain a bonus.
Served drinks and made cocktails in a busy bar/club.
Responsibility for verfying inventory every week.

work.summary: STEM careers work experience across various industries during school.
